title: trie: node with invalid number of list elements
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`
OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
Sync chain

#### Actual behaviour
panic

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
geth --rpc

#### Backtrace

``` 
INFO [09-06|12:43:49] Block synchronisation started 
panic: node 2c2d27f6e05dc07fab8fd97720f690b095d64a7d7a8b9054ba9bb8b95d244356: invalid number of list elements: 70

goroutine 1839 [running]:
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.mustDecodeNode(0xc4260a8040, 0x20, 0x20, 0xc425ff5b00, 0x214, 0x240, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)

````
Could you provide any more info ? Were you synching from scratch, or close to the head?

Please follow the instructions below to display the offending value in your database. This would help us with debugging the issue.

```shell
# install go compiler
apt get install golang

# set up go environment
mkdir ~/go
export GOPATH=$HOME/go

# clone go-ethereum source code
go get github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum
cd ~/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum

# download and run program that shows the value
curl -O https://gist.githubusercontent.com/fjl/be3e98898850e610aab9f966885c7007/raw/d3376bb14c442bceb1b0da8b5383cb6c521c59a4/checknode.go
go run checknode.go ~/.ethereum/geth/chaindata
```

checknode.go content:
```go
package main

import (
	"encoding/hex"
	"fmt"
	"os"

	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/ethdb"
)

func main() {
	db, _ := ethdb.NewLDBDatabase(os.Args[1], 100, 100)
	key, _ := hex.DecodeString("f4eaf1c79a8d751566fa3228c17195c15ef6e396d09da47159e122093a011cd7")
	val, _ := db.Get(key)
	fmt.Println(hex.EncodeToString(val))
}
```
go run checknode.go ~/.ethereum/geth/chaindata output:

```

```
